unnormalised: Hey everyone! Thinking about dipping my toes into the world of mental health apps. Has anyone had any experience with them? I'm really curious about whether they're actually helpful, or just another fad.
normalised: Hey everyone! Thinking about dipping my toes into the world of mental health apps. Has anyone had any experience with them? I'm really curious about whether they're actually helpful, or just another fad.

unnormalised: Specifically, I'm looking for something that might help with managing stress and anxiety. Life in Mumbai is already a bit hectic, what with the constant travel and deadlines. Dr. Sharma, my family physician, suggested I try some mindfulness techniques, and an app seemed like a convenient way to get started.
normalised: Specifically, I'm looking for something that might help with managing stress and anxiety. Life in Mumbai is already a bit hectic, what with the constant travel and deadlines. Doctor Sharma, my family physician, suggested I try some mindfulness techniques, and an app seemed like a convenient way to get started.

unnormalised: I’ve seen ads for apps like Headspace and Calm, but they seem kinda… generic? Are there any apps out there that are a bit more culturally sensitive, maybe even include elements of Indian philosophy or yoga? I remember reading about an app developed at NIMHANS, Bangalore, a while back, but I can't recall the name.
normalised: I’ve seen ads for apps like Headspace and Calm, but they seem kind of… generic? Are there any apps out there that are a bit more culturally sensitive, maybe even include elements of Indian philosophy or yoga? I remember reading about an app developed at N I M H A N S, Bangalore, a while back, but I can't recall the name.

unnormalised: Also, budget is a concern. Some of these apps have hefty subscription fees (like Rs. 2000/month!). Are there decent free or low-cost alternatives? I'd rather spend that money on some good jalebis at my local sweet shop.
normalised: Also, budget is a concern. Some of these apps have hefty subscription fees (like rupee two thousand per month!). Are there decent free or low-cost alternatives? I'd rather spend that money on some good jalebis at my local sweet shop.

unnormalised: Ultimately, I'm hoping to find something that can help me carve out a small space for calm in my 500 sq ft apartment. Any recommendations or personal experiences would be greatly appreciated! Thanks in advance, and namaste!
normalised: Ultimately, I'm hoping to find something that can help me carve out a small space for calm in my five hundred square feet apartment. Any recommendations or personal experiences would be greatly appreciated! Thanks in advance, and namaste!
